# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    line = String[]
    current_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) > text_width
            push!(line, "")
            current_length = length(word)
        end
        current_length += length(word) + length(" ")
        last_word = length(words) > index(words, word) ? words[index(words, word) + 1] : nothing
        if !isempty(last_word) && current_length + length(last_word) <= text_width
            current_word = word * " " * last_word
            current_length += length(last_word)
        else
            push!(line, word)
        end
    end

    if !isempty(last_element(line)) && length(last_element(line)) < text_width
        push!(line, String("" * (" " ^ (text_width - length(last_element(line))))))
    end

    join(line, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.") # "The quick brown fox\njumps over the\nlazy dog."
```
